sen.j: 渡辺 糺（わたなべ ただす、生年不詳 - 慶長20年5月7日 (旧暦)（1615年6月3日））は、豊臣氏家臣。
sen.e: Tadasu WATANABE (the birth year unknown - June 3, 1615) was a vassal of the Toyotomi clan.
Tadasu WATANABE (year of birth unknown - June 3, 1615) was a vassal of the Toyotomi clan.
sen.cmt: カッコ内を修正しました。（用語統一）
sen.e: Tadasu WATANABE (year of birth unknown - June 3, 1615) was a vassal of the Toyotomi clan.
He got Chigyo (enfeoffment) of a thousands Goku crop yields
He was enfeoffed 1,000 koku.
sen.cmt: 文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: He was enfeoffed 1,000 koku.
His common name was Kura no suke
His common name was Kura no suke
His common name was Kura no suke
He is a son of Masa Watanabe.
He is a son of Masa WATANABE.
He is a son of Masa WATANABE.

sen.j: 母は淀殿の側近の正栄尼。
sen.e: His mother was Shoeini, a close adviser of Yodo-dono (Lady Yodo).
His mother was Shoeini, a close adviser of Yodo-dono (Lady Yodo).
His mother was Shoeini, a close adviser of Yodo-dono (Lady Yodo).
His sons include Mamoru WATANABE.
His sons include Mamoru WATANABE.
His sons include Mamoru WATANABE.

sen.j: 槍の名手であり、豊臣秀頼の槍の指南役として仕える。
sen.e: He was a master of the spear and served Hideyori TOYOTOMI as an instructor of the art of spears.
He was a master of the spear and served Hideyori TOYOTOMI as the instructor of the art of spears.
He was a master of the spear and served Hideyori TOYOTOMI as the instructor of the art of spears.

sen.j: 大坂冬の陣では鴫野の戦いで上杉景勝と争うも敗退する。
sen.e: He fought and was defeated by Kagekatsu UESUGI in the Battle of Kamono of Osaka Fuyu no Jin (Winter Siege of Osaka).
He fought and was defeated by Kagekatsu UESUGI in the Battle of Kamono of Osaka Fuyu no Jin (Winter Siege of Osaka).
He fought and was defeated by Kagekatsu UESUGI in the Battle of Kamono of Osaka Fuyu no Jin (Winter Siege of Osaka).

sen.j: 尚、この時上杉軍の大量の鉄砲が鳴り響く轟音を聞いただけで兵を退いたとされ、笑い者となる。
sen.e: He was also said in this battle to have made his troops retrieve upon hearing a large number of guns roar, making a fun of himself..
Furthermore, he was also said in this battle to have made his army draw back upon hearing a large number of guns roar, then became a laughingstock.
sen.cmt: furthermore を挿入し、troops→army,retrieve→draw back,making a fun of himself→then became a laughingstock と修正しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, he was also said in this battle to have made his army draw back upon hearing a large number of guns roar, then became a laughingstock.

sen.j: 大坂夏の陣では真田信繁の寄騎として冬の陣の汚名を晴らすべく道明寺の戦いや天王寺・岡山の戦いを転戦。
sen.e: In the Battle of Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka), he took part in battles of Domyoji War, Tennoji War, and Okayama War as Yoriki (lower-ranked Samurai) to clear his reputation in Fuyu no Jin.

In the Battle of Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka), he took a part in battles of Domyoji War, Tennoji War, and Okayama War as a Yoriki (lower-ranked Samurai) to clear his reputation in the Fuyu no Jin.
sen.cmt: a, the を挿入しました。
sen.e: In the Battle of Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka), he took a part in battles of Domyoji War, Tennoji War, and Okayama War as a Yoriki (lower-ranked Samurai) to clear his reputation in the Fuyu no Jin.

sen.j: 最後は大坂城千畳敷で自害。
sen.e: He killed himself in Senjojiki (a hall of one thousand mats) of Osaka Castle in the end.
He killed himself in the Senjojiki (a hall of 1,000 mats) of Osaka-jo Castle in the end.
sen.cmt: the を挿入し、Osaka Castle→Osaka-jo Castle,one thousand→1,000,スペースを修正しました。
sen.e: He killed himself in the Senjojiki (a hall of 1,000 mats) of Osaka-jo Castle in the end.

sen.j: 一説によると一旦京まで逃れたが、秀頼の自害を聞いて自身も立ったまま切腹したという。
sen.e: Some suggest that he was initially successful in fleeing to Kyoto but committed Seppuku (suicide by disembowelment) without sitting down upon hearing Hideyori's suicide.
Some says that he was initially successful in fleeing to Kyoto but committed seppuku (suicide by disembowelment) without sitting down upon hearing Hideyori's suicide.
Some says that he was initially successful in fleeing to Kyoto but committed seppuku (suicide by disembowelment) without sitting down upon hearing Hideyori's suicide.

sen.j: 人柄について、冬の陣の前に大野治長と意見が対立しあわや斬り合いになる出来事があった。
sen.e: There was an event to show his personality that he was about to fight Harunaga ONO with swords because of divided opinions before Fuyu no Jin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処、また「」の対応から、和文を次文の一部と組み合わせ変えてあります。
sen.e: There was an event to show his personality that he was about to fight Harunaga ONO with swords due to their opposite viewpoints before the Fuyu no Jin.
sen.cmt: because of divided opinions→due to their opposite viewpoints と修正し、the を挿入しました。
sen.e: There was an event to show his personality that he was about to fight Harunaga ONO with swords due to their opposite viewpoints before the Fuyu no Jin.

sen.j: 後藤基次は「双方とも死ねばよい」と口走ったとされる。
sen.e: Mototsugu GOTO is said to have said, "It is better for the both to be killed."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処、また「」の対応から、和文を前文の一部と組み合わせ変えてあります。
sen.e: Mototsugu GOTO is said to have said, "It is better for the both to be killed."
Mototsugu GOTO is said to have said, "It is better for the both to be killed."

sen.j: 少なくとも人望のある方では無いと思われる。
sen.e: This shows that Tadasu WATANABE did not win a great popularity.
This shows that Tadasu WATANABE did not win a great popularity.
This shows that Tadasu WATANABE did not win a great popularity.
